snippet: Karaite Jews, who split from rabbinical Judaism more than 1,000 years ago, say that the Orthodox authorities have tried to subsume them into the rabbinical mainstream.
abstract: Karaite Jews, who split from rabbinical Judaism more than 1,000 years ago, say that Orthodox authorities in Israel have tried to subsume them into the rabbinical mainstream.
lead_paragraph: Karaite Jews, who split from rabbinical Judaism more than 1,000 years ago, say that the Orthodox authorities have tried to subsume them into the rabbinical mainstream.

headline.main: New Generation of Jewish Sect Takes Up Struggle to Protect Place in Modern Israel
headline.print_headline: New Generation of Jewish Sect Takes Up Struggle to Protect Place in Modern Israel
